intro: Homalium chocoense, commonly known as the Chocoan beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that produce small, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. The berries are typically consumed by birds, which aid in seed dispersal.
